Valve's first game, which became one of the best FPS ever created. Half-life is over 20 years old, but it is still an excellent game, being better than several more recent games. In the game we control Gordon Freeman, a scientist (who knows how to use weapons), that upon arriving at his workplace, Black Mesa Research Facility, witness an opening of a portal that releases dangerous creatures that will put everyone's life at risk. That's where the game begins. As a great FPS game, we can move around, jump, shoot, crouch, push objects (albeit in a rather strange way) and we can also make actions, such as clicking a button, turning a valve, etc. The ambience of the game is excellent, both the indoor and outdoor areas.  Gordon is speechless during the entire game, however, we will meet other humans, scientists, security guards (who are helping us) and soldiers (who have orders to kill us). The variety of weapons is huge, we have the iconic crowbar, pistols, shotguns, grenades, mines, crossbows, rocket launchers, ray guns and weapons that the creatures use. Talking now about the creatures, the variety is also huge, the famous headcrab, the Vortigaunt, the blind but extremely dangerous Tentacle and many others that we find throughout the game. Each enemy requires a certain strategy, or not, it will depend on you. The game also contains some puzzles, some easier, others more difficult. The only problem I had was sometimes that Gordon just got stuck (it happened about 3 times), and I had to go to another save. Half-life is an old game, but it is still a great game that is very worth playing. The game deserves 9.8 / 10.

Half Life is pretty fun and I would likely recommend it based solely on it's low system requirements. Half Life has a bizarre difficulty curve that really caught me off guard and some sometimes confusing level design. I frequently found myself abusing the quick save (F6) and quick load (F7) function. 

Half Life's older game play definitely isn't for everyone and it would be a mistake to play the game based on the blind hype that plagues the review section.

I know half life 1 is not necessarily favored in its community compared to half life 2. However, that doesn’t mean that this game isn’t plenty of fun. The enemy encounters are varied and fun to strategize, due to the fairly advanced AI for 1998. This doesn’t mean the game is perfect however. Xen can be especially frustrating and drawn out and some escort tasks are a bit, well, troublesome to say the least. While the AIs great for enemies, it falters with NPCs and path finding a bit, causing you to sometimes get stuck when an npc blocks your way. For the ten dollar admission fee however, you’re still getting a great game even if dated in some ways, it’s valves first game and it really shows their talent as a studio.

Игра которая ПЕРЕВЕРНУЛА индустрию игр.Обычный бывший работник Майкрософт Гейб Ньюелл собрал небольшую команду, и сделала революцию в жанре игр.Half life показал КАК надо делать игры, обратите внимание что эта игра и по сей год пока остаётся неплохим шутаном с головоломками и довольно с интересным сюжетом, а игра ЗАМЕТЕ был выпущена в 1998 году! И халва даже становится лучше благодаря турнирам.Без неё не было довольно хороших модов как гаррис (гаррис мод был выпущен после half life 2, на движке source) или cs 1.6, а эти моды были созданы коммьюнити (сообществом), которая была восхищена самой игрой в целом.Вы сейчас напишите в в инете "Моды для half life", и вы увидите огромное разнообразных модов, которые бывают интересней чем сама half life.Если кто-то хочет купить её чтобы поиграть довольно интересный шутер и с хорошим сюжетом, покупайте не пожалеете.

It's half life, a game that inspired many games and developers to this day.

Trochę nie rozumiem fenomu tej gry. Jest dosyć specyficznym połączeniem strzelanki i platformówki. Przez praktycznie całą grę (nie licząc końca) biegamy po placówce Black Mesa w celu wydostania się z niej. Mamy jak na te czasy rewolucyjne wprowadzenie fabularne, silnik graficzny, aczkolwiek robią one dzisiaj o wiele mniejsze wrażenie. Głównym problemem gry jest to, że się zestarzała - przechodzenie przez kolejne korytarze jest nieintuicyjne, uporczywe, toteż znacznie zmniejsza to przyjemność z grania, nie wspominając o przestarzałej grafice. Niezależnie od wszystkiego uważam jednak, że warto zagrać w Half-Life'a, który ukształtował rynek strzelanek po dziś dzień.
Ocena: 6,5/10

This game is absolutely based. Great combat, fun weapons, amazing levels, unmatched atmosphere, and tripmine staircases. It has some rough patches (surface tension is a pain in the ass), but is an amazing experience the whole way through. And once you do finish it, the first thing you want to do is play the whole thing over again. Also has amazing modding support and some cool addons. Overall, play it.

Also, the multiplayer is super chaotic but pretty fun, especially on crossfire. The ability to launch a nuke is perhaps one of the greatest design choices in gaming history.

Aged like a fine wine. After more than 20 years this game still feels refreshing and creative. The level design, atmosphere, attention to detail and environmental storytelling are timeless. Half life (as a whole series) is like the original Star Wars trilogy, the first two Terminator movies or Kubrick's 2001 etc... it's timeless. Half Life set new standards for the PC FPS genre that are now followed by countless developers. There are just a few games that I would consider a "must play" for everyone and this is definitely one of them.

An amazing FPS that revolutionized story telling in shooters. It may look a bit ugly but that's where Black Mesa comes in. Black Mesa is a fan-made remake of Half-Life which was approved by Valve. If you can afford it then buy it instead as Half-Life hasn't aged the best and the last few levels are a pain.
